        ctrl - The control

        ctrl - The control

      • visitControl

        <T> boolean visitControl​(ILayer layer,
                         Visitor<T> visitor,
                         java.lang.Class<T> ctrlClazz)
        Invokes the specified visitor on the specified control for the specified layer. The visitor MAY NOT raise an exception during its invocation. If invoked, the visitor's invocation is always completed before this method returns.

        Client code should only interact with the control during the invocation of the visitor. Caching the reference to the control and attempting to use it outside of the invocation may lead to undefined results.

        Parameters:
        layer - The layer
        visitor - The visitor
        ctrlClazz - The class that the control derives from
        Returns:
        true if the control could be found and the visitor was invoked, false otherwise.

      • visitControls

        boolean visitControls​(ILayer layer,
                      Visitor<java.util.Iterator<java.lang.Object>> visitor)
        Invokes the specified visitor on the controls for the specified layer. The visitor MAY NOT raise an exception during its invocation. If invoked, the visitor's invocation is always completed before this method returns.

        Client code should only interact with the controls during the invocation of the visitor. Caching the reference to the controls and attempting to use any outside of the invocation may lead to undefined results.

        Parameters:
        layer - The layer
        visitor - The visitor
        Returns:
        true if controls for the layer were available and the visitor was invoked, false otherwise.

      • visitControls

        void visitControls​(Visitor<java.util.Iterator<java.util.Map.Entry<ILayer,​java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object>>>> visitor)
        Invokes the specified visitor on the controls across all layers that have had controls registered. The visitor MAY NOT raise an exception during its invocation. If invoked, the visitor's invocation is always completed before this method returns.

        Client code should only interact with the controls during the invocation of the visitor. Caching the reference to the controls and attempting to use any outside of the invocation may lead to undefined results.

        Parameters:
        visitor - The visitor

      • getControl

        <T> T getControl​(java.lang.Class<T> controlType)
        Retrives the specified renderer control. Renderer controls are valid for the lifetime of the associated renderer.

        Note that renderer controls may also be obtained via the various visitControls(...) methods by specifying a null Layer.

        Parameters:
        controlType - The control type
        Returns:
        The renderer control, or null if the renderer does not have a control of the specified type.

      • lookAt

        boolean lookAt​(GeoPoint at,
               double resolution,
               double azimuth,
               double tilt,
               IMapRendererEnums.CameraCollision collision,
               boolean animate)
        Looks at the specified location
        Parameters:
        at - The location to look at
        resolution - The nominal display resolution at the location
        azimuth - The rotation, degrees from north CW
        tilt - The tilt angle from the surface tangent plane at the location

      • lookFrom

        boolean lookFrom​(GeoPoint from,
                 double azimuth,
                 double elevation,
                 IMapRendererEnums.CameraCollision collision,
                 boolean animate)
        Looks from the specified location per the specified angles.
        Parameters:
        azimuth - Rotation from north, clockwise in degrees
        elevation - Angle in degrees. Zero is horizontal to the tangent plane at the from location, greater than zero is upward with 90 straight up, less than zero is downward with -90 straight down

      • isAnimating

        boolean isAnimating()

      • getMapSceneModel

        MapSceneModel getMapSceneModel​(boolean instant,
                               IMapRendererEnums.DisplayOrigin origin)
        Retrieves the model for the scene.
        Parameters:
        instant - If true, returns the current, intra animation state. If false returns the target state for any animation that is currently processing.
        origin - The desired origin representation for the returned scene model
        Returns:
        The scene model

      • forward

        boolean forward​(GeoPoint lla,
                PointD xyz,
                IMapRendererEnums.DisplayOrigin origin)
        Transforms the specified world coordinate into view space.
        Parameters:
        lla - The world location, altitude is considered if valid
        xyz - Returns the view space location on success
        origin - The relative origin for the viewspace
        Returns:
        true if the coordinate was trasnformed, false> otherwise

      • inverse

        IMapRendererEnums.InverseResult inverse​(PointD xyz,
                                        GeoPoint lla,
                                        IMapRendererEnums.InverseMode mode,
                                        int modeHints,
                                        IMapRendererEnums.DisplayOrigin origin)
        Transforms the specified view space coordinate into world space.
        Parameters:
        xyz - The view space location; xyz.z is ignored if mode is IMapRendererEnums.InverseMode.RayCast or
        lla - Returns the world location, per the specified mode
        mode - The inverse mode to be used, refer to IMapRendererEnums.InverseMode
        modeHints - The bitwise OR of any hints to be applied. See IMapRendererEnums.HINT_RAYCAST_IGNORE_SURFACE_MESH. IMapRendererEnums.HINT_RAYCAST_IGNORE_TERRAIN_MESH
        origin - The relative origin for the viewspace
        Returns:
        true if the coordinate was trasnformed, false> otherwise
